headline: Data center cooling-related stocks drop after Nvidia CEO Huang's comments
summary: Shares of U.S. heating, ventilation and air conditioning-related companies dropped on Tuesday after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ​said that the company's upcoming chips could significantly reduce cooling ‌requirements in data centers.  Johnson Controls International dropped 7.5% to $112.40 and Trane Technologies lost 5.3% to $370.40. ‌Both stocks hit multi-month lows and were among the biggest percentage decliners on the S&P 500.  Speaking at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas on Monday, Huang said Nvidia's next generation of chips is in "full production."

Speaking at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas on Monday, Huang said Nvidia's next generation of chips is in "full production."

headline: Data-Center Cooling Stocks Sink After Nvidia CEO’s CES Talk
summary: Shares of Trane Technologies Plc, which makes water-chilled cooling equipment and similar systems, tumbled as much as 11% in the worst intraday drop since 2020.  Modine Manufacturing Co. fell as much as 21%, while Johnson Controls International Plc and Carrier Global Corp. also slid.

raw.headline: Data-Center Cooling Stocks Sink After Nvidia CEO’s CES Talk

headline: Is Nvidia disrupting HVAC? Johnson Controls, Trane  shares dip amid cooling shift
summary: Investing.com -- Johnson Controls (NYSE:JCI) stock fell 2.6% Tuesday following concerns that Nvidia’s (NASDAQ:NVDA) new Rubin chip platform could significantly reduce cooling requirements in data centers, potentially impacting HVAC companies’ future performance.

headline: Automated Logic Completes Acquisition of CCG Automation, Expanding Presence in Ohio
summary: Automated Logic Contracting Services, Inc. (ALCS), a leading provider of innovative building-management solutions and a part of Carrier Global Corporation (NYSE: CARR), global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions, today announced that it has acquired substantially all of the assets of CCG Automation, Inc. (CCG), a leading provider of building automation solutions headquartered in Richfield, Ohio.
